result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenyon A Herbert

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenyon A Herbert in court.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD PER COURT.
Defendant appeared in person and is unable to appear by phone means. Court ordered matter adjourned to an in person court date.
Case remains calendared in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kenyon A Herbert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dean Douglas Sopcic appeared by video for Kenyon A Herbert. Student Intern Lukas Jaeger under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
